subject: RE: [junit] javax.naming.ConfigurationException: Malformed provider URL: corbaloc:iiop:localhost
msgSnippet: Hi swetha yalamanchili, The error stack reports that you have a  Malformed provider URL: corbaloc:iiop:localhost . I would look into that direction.  It does
messageBody:
Hi swetha yalamanchili,

The error stack reports that you have a " Malformed provider URL: corbaloc:iiop:localhost". I would look into that direction. It does not look to me like a JUnit related problem.

One suggestion: all JUnit assertEquals methods have the following order:

1. expected value
2. actual value

From what I understand reading your code you are calling assertEquals in the opposite order. If the test fails, you will get a confusing response from JUnit. This will not fix your problem but is something to keep in mind.

Andreas


________________________________________
From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of swetha yalamanchili
Sent: Friday, June 23, 2006 3:27 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] javax.naming.ConfigurationException: Malformed provider URL: corbaloc:iiop:localhost

hi folks,
when i run this test case on ibmwebserver i am getting error.I am getting the same error since 4days
please help me


package com.ibm.ejb;
import junit.framework.TestCase;
import java.util.Hashtable;
import java.util.Properties;
import junit.framework.*;
import java.rmi.RemoteException;
import javax.naming.Context;
import javax.naming.InitialContext;
import javax.naming.NameNotFoundException;
import javax.naming.NamingException;
import javax.rmi.PortableRemoteObject;
import java.util.Collection;
public class SampleEJBBeanTest extends TestCase {
private SampleEJB sample;
/**
* Constructor for SampleEJBBeanTest.
* @param arg0
*/
public SampleEJBBeanTest(String arg0) {
super(arg0);
}
public static void main(String[] args) {
junit.textui.TestRunner.run(SampleEJBBeanTest.class);
}
/**
* @see TestCase#setUp()
*/
protected void setUp() throws Exception {
{
java.util.Hashtable env = new Hashtable();
env.put(Context.INITIAL_CONTEXT_FACTORY,"com.ibm.websphere.naming.WsnInitialContextFactory");
env.put(Context.PROVIDER_URL,"iiop://localhost:2809");
Context jndiContext = new InitialContext();
Object objRef = jndiContext.lookup("ejb/com/ibm/ejb/SampleEJB");
SampleEJBHome home = (SampleEJBHome)PortableRemoteObject.narrow(objRef,SampleEJBHome.class);
this.sample= home.create();
}
}
public void testAdd() {
SampleEJBBean sam=new SampleEJBBean();
int c = sam.add(10,15);
assertEquals(c,25);
}
}

--------------------------------------------ERROR-----------------------------
javax.naming.ConfigurationException: Malformed provider URL: corbaloc:iiop:localhost

at junit.framework.TestResult.runProtected(TestResult.java:124)
